repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Financial Sector
            Adjustment Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Financial Sector
            Adjustment Program Project for Cote d'Ivoire was highly
            satisfactory. The project achieved its objectives, its
            impact on institutional development was substantial,
            sustainability is likely, and the performance of both the
            Bank and Borrower was highly satisfactory. Several lessons
            can be learned from this project. First, Government
            commitment and political will are the key elements for
            success. Second, the project illustrates the merits of
            setting conditionality in a precise fashion rather than in
            terms of broad objectives. Third, program implementation
            highlights the intensive supervision that adjustment
            programs require, particularly when implementation is drawn
            out by delayed compliance. Fourth, it may be worthwhile to
            take a calculated risk by initially going ahead with a
            restructuring program in the absence of a suitable macro
            framework if restructured institutions are shielded from the
            negative impact of an unfavorable macro environment by a
            conservative, independent, and private management backed by
            a strong political will to implement reforms, restore market
            mechanisms, and instill strong regulation and supervision.
            Finally, Bank privatization should be a Board condition, not
            a condition for tranche release.
